{{tt|std::nullopt_t}} is an empty class type used to indicate that an {{lc|std::optional}} does not contain a value.

{{tt|std::nullopt_t}} is a non-aggregate {{named req|LiteralType}} that has no default constructor, no initializer-list constructor, but does have a {{tt|constexpr}} constructor that takes an implementation-defined literal type.

===Notes===
The constraints on {{tt|nullopt_t}}'s constructors exist to support both {{c|1=op = {};}} and {{c|1=op = nullopt;}} as the syntax for disengaging an optional object. 

A possible implementation of this class is
{{source|
struct nullopt_t {
    constexpr explicit nullopt_t(int) {}
};
}}
